name: One Pillar Pagoda
description: One Pillar Pagoda is a historic Buddhist temple in Hanoi, known for its unique structure, which stands on a single pillar in the middle of a pond.

name: Tran Quoc Pagoda
description: Located on the West Lake in Hanoi, Tran Quoc Pagoda is one of the oldest and most famous pagodas in Vietnam, with a history dating back over 1,500 years.

name: Bao An Pagoda
description: Bao An Pagoda, located in the central highlands of Vietnam, is known for its peaceful atmosphere and stunning views of the surrounding landscape.

name: Thien Mu Pagoda
description: Thien Mu Pagoda is a famous Buddhist pagoda in Hue, known for its beautiful location by the Perfume River and its historical significance during the Nguyen dynasty.

name: Chùa Bái Đính
description: Located in Ninh Bình, Bái Đính Pagoda is one of the largest and most famous pagodas in Vietnam, known for its massive statues and beautiful surroundings.

name: Linh Ung Pagoda
description: Located in Da Nang, Linh Ung Pagoda is known for its 67-meter statue of the Buddha and its panoramic view of the city and the coastline.

name: Vinh Nghiem Pagoda
description: Vinh Nghiem Pagoda in Ho Chi Minh City is a large and important Buddhist pagoda that serves as a spiritual center for the city's Buddhist community.

name: Tam Chuc Pagoda
description: Tam Chuc Pagoda is a large Buddhist complex in Ha Nam province, known for its impressive architecture and serene surroundings.

name: Phat Tich Pagoda
description: Phat Tich Pagoda is located in Bac Ninh province and is famous for its large statue of the Buddha and its historical significance in the development of Buddhism in Vietnam.

name: Chùa Hương
description: Hương Pagoda is located in a scenic area near Hanoi, attracting pilgrims from all over Vietnam who come to worship and enjoy the beautiful landscape.

name: Ba Na Hills Pagoda
description: Ba Na Hills Pagoda is located on top of the Ba Na Mountain near Da Nang. It is famous for the Golden Bridge and the stunning views of the surrounding area.

name: Giac Lam Pagoda
description: Giac Lam Pagoda, one of the oldest pagodas in Ho Chi Minh City, has a rich history and is an important center for the city's Buddhist community.

name: Chùa Đồng
description: Chùa Đồng, also known as the Copper Pagoda, is located on Mount Yen Tu in Quang Ninh. It is famous for its copper statue of the Buddha and its spiritual significance.

name: Sakyamuni Pagoda
description: Sakyamuni Pagoda is located in Ho Chi Minh City and is known for its serene atmosphere and significant role in the practice of Vietnamese Buddhism.
